doc:
David Swift (director) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Swift_(director) 0 David "Dave" Swift (July 27, 1919 – December 31, 2001) was an American screenwriter, animator, director, and producer. He is best known for writing the screenplay for the 1967 film, How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying. Swift also worked as an animator and filmmaker at The Walt Disney Studios where he adapted the story of Pollyanna for the screen and wrote and directed The Parent Trap (1961). David_"_Dave_"_Swift ( July_27_,_1919 – December_31_,_2001 ) was an_American_screenwriter , animator , director , and producer . He is_best_known for writing the_screenplay for the_1967_film , How to_Succeed in Business Without Really Trying . Swift also worked as an_animator_and_filmmaker at The_Walt_Disney_Studios where he adapted the_story of Pollyanna for the_screen and wrote and directed The_Parent_Trap_(_1961_) .
